rundown: 8-6 W vs Miami Marlins Carlos Carrasco: 5.2 innings, 6 earned runs, 9 hits, 1 HR, 2 strikeouts Batters: Drake Baldwin (3 hits - 4 AB, 2 HR, 5 RBI) Marcell Ozuna (3 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Matt Olson (2 hits - 4 AB, 0 HR, 0 RBI) The Braves secured a victory against the Miami Marlins with a strong offensive performance, scoring 8 runs on 12 hits. Drake Baldwin was the standout player, hitting two home runs and driving in five runs. Marcell Ozuna also contributed significantly with three hits, including a home run. Despite Carlos Carrasco allowing six earned runs, the Braves' offense was able to outpace the Marlins. Key highlights include: 1. Drake Baldwin's impressive performance with two home runs and five RBIs. 2. Marcell Ozuna's contribution with a home run and three hits. 3. The Braves' ability to capitalize on their scoring opportunities, leading to an 8-run game.
